meanings.definition: Capable of being degraded or broken down into simpler substances.
meanings.sent1: The plastic bag's degradability allowed it to easily break down in the environment.
meanings.sent2: The degradability of the paper made it a great choice for composting.
meanings.sent3: The degradability of the cardboard box made it disappear like magic!
meanings.sent4: The degradability of the sugar cube was so rapid, it seemed to vanish before our eyes.
meanings.sent5: The degradability of the leaves in the compost pile was a fascinating process to watch.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be decomposed or broken down naturally.
meanings.sent1: The degradability of organic matter is essential for soil health.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the degradability of materials to understand their impact on the environment.
meanings.sent3: The degradability of the fallen leaves turned the ground into a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent4: The degradability of time slowly erodes even the mightiest mountains.
meanings.sent5: The degradability of the fallen tree trunk was a testament to nature's recycling process.
